text: Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live
author: Steve McConnell

text: Program complexity grows until it exceeds the capability of theprogrammer who must maintain it
author: Arthur Bloch. Murphy's Laws

text: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen
author: Edward V. Berard

text: There is no time in eternity. Eternity is just a moment, which is enough for one joke
author: Hermann Hesse

text: 'If everything in the world is meaningless,' Alice said — ' what prevents you from inventing some meaning?'
author: Lewis Carroll 'Alice in Wonderland'

text: Today you make code, tomorrow code makes you money
author: Steve Jobs

text: Coffee doesn't help programming, but it tastes good
author: D. Gosling

text: There are no good languages, there are good programmers
author: A. Heilsberg

text: Life's a tough proposition, and the first hundred years are the hardest
author: Wilson Mizner

text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched. They must be felt with the heart
author: H. Keller

text: Life is too short to do what you don't like
author: Richard Branson

text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving
author: Albert Einstein

text: It always seems impossible until it’s done
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself in your way of thinking
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: If you want to live a happy life, tie it to a goal. Not to people or things
author: Albert Einstein
